content.question: Which of the following overall conclusions can best be drawn from the data presented in the graph?

choices.label: While the South remained the main region of arrival of enslaved Africans during the period 1619–1860, the share of arrivals in various southern subregions shifted during this period.
The enslaved Africans who were transported to mainland North America predominantly came from the contemporary African regions of the Ivory Coast, Nigeria, Angola, and Sierra Leone.
Of the 12.5 million enslaved Africans who survived the journey to the Americas, approximately 388,000 (5%) arrived in what is now the United States.
Throughout the American South, enslaved Africans created culturally distinct local communities based on West and Central African cultural practices.

content.answer: While the South remained the main region of arrival of enslaved Africans during the period 1619–1860, the share of arrivals in various southern subregions shifted during this period.
